perturbation.original_text: 3.4 Within [*****] as from the date of Delivery of any Item of the Stock, the Company shall be responsible for obtaining and shall provide the Repairer with evidence in respect of (i) custom clearance, including payment fees, customs duties, and (ii) customs declarations, with respect to the relevant Stock Item.
perturbation.changed_text: 3.4 Within [*****] as from the date of Delivery of any Item of the Stock, the Company shall be responsible for obtaining and shall provide the Repairer with evidence in respect of (i) custom clearance, including payment fees, customs duties, and (ii) customs declarations, with respect to the relevant Stock Item. If such evidence is not provided within 7 days, Repairer can charge a penalty fee.
perturbation.explanation: Brazilian customs regulations require specific timelines for customs clearance and documentation. Setting a very short, fixed deadline and adding a penalty fee might not align with the actual legally permissible timeframes and procedures for customs compliance in Brazil, thus introducing a conflict.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Brazilian Customs Regulations (various decrees and normative instructions from the Receita Federal do Brasil)

perturbation.original_text: 3.2 Dispatching the Items (i) Any LRU from the Pool shall be delivered to the Company pursuant to Clause 6.1 of the Agreement within [*****] for routine orders, within [*****] for critical orders or within [*****] for AOG orders (limited to classified "no-go and go if" LRUs according to MMEL) as the case may be, starting from the Day of receipt by the Repairer of a standard exchange Work Order.
perturbation.changed_text: 3.2 Dispatching the Items (i) Any LRU from the Pool shall be delivered to the Company pursuant to Clause 6.1 of the Agreement within 1 hour for routine orders, within 30 minutes for critical orders or within 15 minutes for AOG orders (limited to classified "no-go and go if" LRUs according to MMEL) as the case may be, starting from the Day of receipt by the Repairer of a standard exchange Work Order.
perturbation.explanation: Setting unrealistically short delivery times (1 hour, 30 minutes, 15 minutes) is an inconsistency with realistic business practices. This could be viewed as an unenforceable obligation if the times are impossible to meet due to logistical constraints, conflicting with good faith principles in contract law.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Brazilian Civil Code (Art. 422 - principles of good faith and fair dealing in contractual relations)
